page.title: 19LIFE STYLE IN TILLICOULTRY
page.content: Tillicoultry has always been a{mill town,well known for spinning and weaving blankets and shawls. Patons and Bryants still make high quality woollen goods. Dayglen of Scotland make kilts,Glen Gordon uses cashmere, lambs' wool and Shetland wools for its garments. Today some mill buildings have other uses. Middletons now puts tips on cigarettes. An extension to this factory has just been built on the Alva industrial estate. The Clock Mill was once water powered. It is now an information centre and a workshop to train apprentices to work on hand looms.{Landmarks}in Tillicoultry are the Pedestal Clock in Murray Square and the Town{Clock}with its 4 faces and 4 beautiful turrets.
